title: Jubilee celebrations week: Canberra

abstract: On May 9 1951, there was a public holiday for the Jubilee opening of Parliament. Prominent in the celebrations was Australian Governor-General McKell.
description: This film records some of Canberra's 1951 Jubilee celebrations, showing crowds at a parade outside Parliament house including trooping of the colours and armoured vehicles. There are also scenes at Duntroon, including of the Governor General Sir William McKell arriving and taking the salute, inspecting troops and the band; arrival of official guests and viewing of the march past. Later this year, McKell became the only Governor General of Australia to be knighted during his term.
